content:
That's a great plan! By asking Alex about his experience with suspension and differential settings, you can gain valuable insights from someone who has hands-on experience with a similar vehicle. Preparing specific questions beforehand will help you get the most out of your conversation, and actively listening to his advice will ensure that you understand his points and can apply them to your own car.

Remember to ask open-ended questions that encourage Alex to share his thoughts and experiences in detail. For example, you could ask:

* Can you walk me through your process for setting up your suspension and differential for a track day?
* How do you adjust your suspension and differential settings for different tracks and conditions?
* What are some common mistakes people make when setting up their suspension and differential, and how can I avoid them?

By asking questions like these, you can tap into Alex's knowledge and experience and get a better understanding of how to optimize your own car's suspension and differential settings.

Good luck with your conversation, and I hope you learn some valuable tips and tricks from Alex!
